subject: Psychology
title: Freud and the Unconscious
description: A short lesson to help you apply Freud and the Unconscious.

hook.text: A man can't move his hand. Doctors find nothing wrong. Freud suggests the paralysis is in the mind, not the body.

buildup.text: Sigmund Freud proposed that unconscious desires, memories, and conflicts drive much of human behavior.

discovery.text: His model divided the psyche into id (desires), ego (reality), and superego (morality) ‚Äî constantly in conflict.

twist.text: Most of Freud's specific theories were rejected by science. Yet his core insight ‚Äî the unconscious matters ‚Äî endures.

climax.text: Freud changed the conversation. After him, no one could ignore the hidden forces shaping thought and behavior.

punchline.text: Freud was often wrong, but he asked questions nobody else dared.

quiz.question: What are Freud's three components of the psyche?
